intro: Iberidella, commonly known as the Iberian bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plants typically have hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, often growing in rocky or limestone soils. Iberidella species are known for their showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. These plants are often found in open woodlands and scrublands, contributing to the region's floral diversity.
